attributes.action: Ban full face coverings & garments where only the eyes can be seen for security
attributes.background: The governments of Cameroon, Chad, Congo, Egypt, Morocco, Niger & Tunisia (after a terrorist attack) have all banned full face coverings garments where only the  eyes can be seen for national security reasons. This proves they are not a religious requirement. As such we should too.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634661

Just because certain countries have banned a practice, this does not mean that it is not a religious requirement for certain people.
